lookup timestep

Source: R/lookup_timestep.R
lookup_timestep.Rd

This function returns the timestep or timesteps associated with x in a particular BirdFlow model, where x represents dates or timesteps in various formats.

Usage

lookup_timestep(x, bf)

Arguments

x

a character object representing date as year-month-day e.g. "2023-03-29", date object (Date, POSIXct, or POSIXlt), a numeric timestep, a character representing a timestep e.g. "t1", or "all" for all timesteps in the model.

bf

a BirdFlow object

Value

a vector of timesteps corresponding to elements in x

Details

So far all BirdFlow objects have had timesteps corresponding with weeks of the year and matching the S&T timesteps. However, it is likely that we will add the ability to make BirdFlow objects that only model part of the year. If we do this the timestep values will not necessarily match weeks. For example a model that covers Week 6, to 20 would have timesteps from 1 to 15.

If x is numeric it is assumed to already be a timestep. This is useful when using this function internally to resolve arguments to other functions like route(), predict(), and get_distr().

Examples

bf <- BirdFlowModels::amewoo
lookup_timestep(c("2001-3-23", "2022-12-05"), bf)
#> [1] 12 49
